results.title: Just another bump in the road!!!
results.creator_credit: Michelle Carlin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Carlin loved her job caring for disabled people. It has encouraged her to take a positive outlook on life no matter how much things go wrong and in turn this has helped her through some very tough times.

results.title: Bringing me home
results.creator_credit: Karen Greer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Mitchell River is the largest unregulated river in Victoria. To Karen Greer, it is her home and ever since childhood, she has navigated the waters and continues tracing the river upstream.

results.title: The Music of Mozart and Haydn
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Lexi Godfrey, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the magnificent Haydnsaal of the Schloss Esterhazy in Eisenstadt, Austria and in the historic palaces of Vienna, the Polish Chamber Orchestra conducted by Jerzy Maksymiuk perform three beautiful pieces of chamber music by two of Austria’s greatest classical composers, Mozart and Haydn. Includes images of some of Austria’s picturesque landscapes, artworks and amazing palaces and gardens creating an ambient background to the music of the Orchestra. No commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dave Heather, Lexi Godfrey, Klein and EMI/Parlophone

results.title: The Academy of St Martin in the Fields at Longleat
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Martin Wyn Griffith, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the idyllic historic Longleat House in Wiltshire, England, this program of popular classics is performed by The Academy of St Martin in the Fields conducted by world-renowned Neville Marriner (also artistic director). Neville Marriner introduces the program and provides a commentary on the history of Longleat House and the music of the great composers of the 17th and 18th centuries. Beautiful images of the Longleat Estate, both interior and exterior, accompany the music to provide an atmospheric re-creation of those earlier centuries.

results.title: Professional Development
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studiesin effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have gone about improving their effectiveness. “Professional development” is the second part in the series and records the manner in which Ivanhoe East Primary School supports its educational program with a coherent, planned program of professional development for its staff.

results.title: Carry on up the Khyber
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Peter Rogers Productions and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
It is 1895 and the British occupation of India is threatened by revolutionary uprisings. In order for the revolutionaries to attack the British troops they need to cross the notorious Khyber Pass. The history and politics of the British Raj, however, is simply a convenient background for the Carry On team to conduct their regular mix of hilarious slap-stick and tongue-in-cheek camp. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims and a large supporting cast of British comedians.

results.title: Follow that camel
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Peter Rogers Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
England, 1906, and all is not cricket. After being tricked and humiliated at a high society club during a cricket match, Bertram West aka Beau (Jim Dale), now disgraced, leaves with batsman Simpson (Peter Butterworth) to join the Foreign Legion to prove his worth. Hot on Beau’s tail is the regretful Lady Jane Ponsonby (Angela Douglas) who travels to restore his reputation whilst losing her own. The usual Carry On crew are joined by Phil Silvers who reprises the Sergeant Bilko character in his role as Sergeant Knocker. A strong performance but distracting from the usual Carry On style. A few saucy surprises along the way, like Anita Harris who, usually type-cast as the wholesome girl next door, plays the shock role (for it’s time), of the erotic belly dancer. Cast includes: Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims and Bernard Bresslaw.

results.title: Carry on doctor
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
Britain’s favourite comedy team “carry on” as they only know how! “Carry on Doctor” looks at life in a country hospital when the patients revolt against the staff. Hattie Jacques is the fearsome Matron, Kenneth Williams the cold-hearted Doctor Tinkle, while Sid James as the malingerer Mr. Roper, takes a vacation in hospital. A madcap romp of bandages and stethescopes, Frankie Howard as Mr. Bigger hams it up while Charles Hawtrey gives an unforgettable performance as an expectant father suffering all the symptoms of pregnancy.
